summary: This bill, the Healthy Moms and Babies Act, aims to improve maternal health coverage under Medicaid and CHIP. It includes provisions for mandatory reporting on maternal and perinatal health, quality improvement initiatives to reduce cesarean section rates, state options for coordinated care through health homes, guidance on care coordination, national reskilling of the maternity care workforce, studies on doulas and community health workers, demonstration projects using telehealth, reports on remote physiologic monitoring devices, and guidance on community-based maternal health programs. The bill also addresses data collection on social determinants of health, payment methodologies for transfers, and payment error rate measurement audits.
